required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radial Forearm Versus the Ulnar Forearm Free Flap
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Functional Outcomes and Morbidity of the Radial Forearm Versus the Ulnar Forearm Free Flap: A Prospective, Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates donor site outcomes in patients receiving radial forearm free flap reconstruction versus ulnar forearm free flap reconstruction. Patients who meet criteria for forearm free flap reconstruction are randomized to receiving either radial forearm free flap or ulnar forearm free flap reconstruction.

detailed_description.textblock: The radial forearm free flap and the ulnar forearm free flap are both well-described procedures used for free tissue transfer in reconstructive surgery. Although forearm free flaps are frequently performed, there is insufficient prospective data looking at the morbidity of the radial compared to ulnar forearm free flaps. The goal of this research study is to characterize the outcomes for each of these two flaps, and to determine if there is surgical equipoise, or if one flap is better than the other.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects are assigned to one of two treatment arms
study_design_info.masking_description: To the extend possible based on the nature of the study, subjects and researchers will be masked from the treatment arms.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Grip Strength (lbs) in the operative hand and non-operative hand
primary_outcome.description: Subjects' grip strength in their operative hand and non-operative hand, each measured as the maximum amount of force applied by the hand to a Jamar Dynometer in pounds.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Key Pinch Strength (lbs) in the operative hand and non-operative hand
primary_outcome.description: Subjects' pinch strength in their operative hand and non-operative hand, each measured as the maximum amount of force applied with key pinch in pounds.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Physician and Patient Rating of Scar Appearance
primary_outcome.description: Subject's and physician's reported assessment of scar appearance on a Likert scale up to 10.

primary_outcome.measure: Aggregated Brief Michigan Hand Questionnaire results (composite score)
primary_outcome.description: Subjects' reported outcomes of hand function, as measured by the brief Michigan Hand Questionnaire survey results, on a scale up to 100.
Subjects' static two point discrimination threshold in their finger pads, palm, and dorsum of the hand, in the operative and non-operative extremity, each measured in millimeters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with complete flap loss
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with complete flap loss as assessed by chart review.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with partial flap loss
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with partial flap loss as assessed by chart review.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients reporting cold intolerance
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients reporting cold intolerance in the operative and non-operative extremity as assessed by patient's response to questioning them about feeling cold intolerance.
Number of patients reporting cold intolerance as assessed by patient's response to questioning them about feeling neuropathy

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with postoperative hematoma at donor site
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with postoperative hematoma at donor site, as assessed by chart review.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with postoperative cellulitis at donor site
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with postoperative cellulitis at donor site as assessed by chart review.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with postoperative hematoma at recipient site
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patient with postoperative hematoma at recipient site, as assessed by chart review

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patient with postoperative infection at recipient site
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patient with postoperative infection at recipient site, as assessed by chart review.
Number of patients experiencing mortality, as assessed by chart review.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with donor site dehiscence
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with donor site dehiscence, as assessed by chart review

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with partial skin graft non-take
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with partial skin graft non-take, as assessed by chart review

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with complete skin graft non-take
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with complete skin graft non-take, as assessed by chart review

arm_group.description: Subjects in this arm will receive a radial forearm free flap.
Subjects in this arm will receive an ulnar forearm free flap.

intervention.description: Subjects in this arm will undergo a radial forearm free flap.
Subjects in this arm will undergo an ulnar forearm free flap.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with planned forearm free flap reconstruction
- Patients who are deemed equal surgical candidates for radial forearm free flap and ulnar forearm free flap reconstruction
- Preoperative Allen's test completed and passed
- Patients have the capacity to complete the informed consent process
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that are not candidates for a forearm flap based on their physiology
- Clinically evident peripheral neuropathy (e.g., diabetic neuropathy, leprosy)
- Patients requiring concurrent forearm bone for reconstruction
- Child, prisoner, or other vulnerable group
